name: methyl_ethyl_sulfide
source: American Petroleum Institute. Research Project 44; Selected Values of Properties of Hydrocarbons and Related Compounds. Texas A & M University; College Station; TX; 1973.
Reason: 1,1'-propane, 3-methyl- (base) has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure and raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The methyl group can contribute approximately +10 to +20 degrees Celsius.
